Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Dear Community  A lot has been said and written about the massive advantages of data marketplaces for sensor owners ‚Äî industries, smart cities, utility providers, the transportation sector.  Thanks to data marketplaces like DataBroker DAO, academics get access to the data from thousands of sensors all over the world and can buy data directly on the marketplace.  You can read more about this here: https://medium.com/databrokerdao/data-marketplaces-more-academic-spin-offs-and-a-boost-in-scientific-breakthroughs-ffe5eae6bb60

Author: hexaman
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Streamr (DATA) is taking their traditional data transfer platform and will attempt to ‚Äúblockhainize‚Äù it. While DataBroker DAO will not go into a deep technical analysis of these projects the conclusion can be drawn from reading the whitepaper that the goal is to replace the entire IoT stack, from top to bottom, with the Streamr solution. A monumental challenge if you keep in mind that if they are operational in 2 years, they will have to replace an industry with 30 billion deployed sensors.

Author: Shawn-Amazix
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: IF you are asking about the competitive environment. DataBroker DAO takes a radically different approach:  - It is built to go into production this year. This ensures we both need to use proven technology, and a first movers advantage over these other players.  - It is built to interface with the large players in the ecosystem (manufacturers and gateway operators) in a non invasive way. We are not replacing anything or anyone, ensuring a low friction environment. The only way to get market scale fast enough.  - It focuses on being a complementary component in the current and future ecosystem, meaning that in the future DataBroker DAO can co-exist, integrate and complement IOTA, Streamr and OceanProtocol.  We wish each and every one of these projects all the success in the world, and we will happily integrate them into the ecosystem upon reaching critical mass.

Author: kvanier
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Try to break the DTX bridge, and earn a bounty!  With such a crucial piece of our architecture and the fact that these contracts will hold lots of value, their security will be critical. That is why we have opened a bounty for any security issues via GitCoin.  The scope of this bounty is to look for bugs in the DataBroker DAO Smart Contracts. Payouts will be made to the first individuals who report bugs, and exploits will be ineligible for payouts if they have already been used on the deployed contracts.  Get the full details at the official Medium post here, and good luck! https://medium.com/databrokerdao/try-to-break-the-dtx-bridge-and-earn-a-bounty-e26f32f43796

Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: DataBroker DAO builds a future where users can sell smart device data on an open market. Farmers can purchase environmental data from sensors across their local area, for example, while universities can access a network of highly accurate data points around the world. That brings many benefits to society and economy.

Author: thanhbinhhe
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: DataBroker DAO is the first marketplace for trading sensor data. As a decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data, Databroker DAO enables sensor owners to turn generated data into revenue streams. By using the DATA token, other relevant parties can access this data for their own interest.

Author: daviszayn
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Sensor owners (data providers) are able to directly monetise their data to generate passive income that will turn a sunk cost into a potential money maker and at least the opportunity to recoup some of their investments in IoT sensors (purchase, installation, maintenance, software licenses to interpret the sensor data)

Author: themathiasmiller
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Definitely this will be the perfect opportunity for sensor owners to profit from their IoT sensors and this will also allow those who are in need of these data but don't have the enough funds to buy a complete sensor access the data that they need. I honestly do have high hopes for DataBroker DAO, the market that this project is gonna attract is huge. There are a lot of companies who are relying on IoT sensors data and through this project not only big companies will be able to benefit from these data but anyone can access and purchase these data so DataBroker DAO is making IoT sensor data accessible to everyone which is revolutionary.

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: DataBroker DAO Announced Chinese Roadshow Dates, Doubles Token Sale Rewards Until June 30th  DataBroker DAO is proud to finally unveil the dates of its roadshow in China. The highly anticipated event brings the blockchain startup to the world's biggest marketplace for the Internet of Things (IoT) sensor data. China currently controls 22% of the global market share and is worth an approximate CNY 500 Billion (80 Billion USD). The market‚Äôs accelerated growth continues to impress analysts who have projected an annual growth rate of 20% to 30% by 2020.  DataBroker DAO sees the Chinese Market as integral to IoT sensor data and hardware, which is the reason behind the startup‚Äôs decision to extend its token sale to June 30th, 2018 in order to present its groundbreaking technology at key conferences in the country and tap into this gigantic market.  Read the details in the article of Coinidol dot com, the world blockchain news outlet: https://coinidol.com/databroker-dao-announced-chinese-roadshow-dates/

Author: thanhbinhhe
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: The data will be streamed from the sensor to the DataBroker DAO platform. There you can find and buy this data from the sensor owner with the DataBroker token. There will be a UI where you can easily add a sensor to the platform and start sharing/selling your streams and generated data.

Author: remodex9
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: With IoT integrator Reekoh, headquartered in Australia, and German software developer digital worx, the DataBroker DAO alliance now has more than 20 worldwide members. Purpose-built for the Internet of Things, Reekoh is an integration fabric that brings together all your IoT devices, networks, data and enterprise systems. Fast to set up and agile to work with, it‚Äôs a highly scalable platform that securely ingests, messages and delivers data between devices and applications. Their IoT Fabric is helping enterprises to take control of their fragmented IoT solutions, unlock the full value of their data, and build capability for the future, whilst their Dashboard Studio allows companies to create fast, shareable dashboards to get a visual handle on their IoT and open data.

Author: Kingrezz
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: The 60% reward applies to everyone who purchased DATA. We will lock up 30% of these tokens for 3 years and an additional 5% of the tokens will be released to new team members over 4 years, effectively decreasing the supply to 146,250,000 DTX. If the hardcap is not reached, the team will still be able to develop the DataBroker platform, and all unsold tokens will be reverted to the platform fund. The hardcap only reflects the maximum needed but not reaching it does not mean the platform or product will suffer as a result.

Author: kvanier
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Leuven-based startup raises virtual millions for trade in sensor data  A Dubai-based subsidiary of the Flemish blockchain company SettleMint has already raised 4 million dollars with the sale of digital tokens, an amount that could still rise. The tokens will become the payment method on DataBroker DAO, an online marketplace for the trade in sensor data.  Read more at our official Medium blog: https://medium.com/databrokerdao/leuven-based-startup-raises-virtual-millions-for-trade-in-sensor-data-e33e621af476

Author: Robbie_ICO
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Am not sure if I understood your question but just note that our earliest supporters, those who purchased the old DATA token, got an equivalent of their original ETH investment at current prices in DTX tokens at a bonus rate of 60% to reward them for their trust in the project.

Author: themathiasmiller
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Honestly I haven't been that much updated on what's been happening with DataBroker DAO cause I've been very busy with work so I have a few questions, is this 60% reward available for all investors that participated during the token sale that started last april? Or is it just for investors who participated during the pre sale? Also what happens to the old DATA token? And lastly what will happen to the project if the hard cap wouldn't be reached, will you still continue? or will the token sale be extended again? Or is this the last extension?

Author: Robbie_ICO
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Each contributor will receive double the worth of their initial cotnribution.  You can find more info about it here:  https://medium.com/databrokerdao/next-steps-for-databrokerdao-and-the-ecosystem-de6770b5a567   The project will still go ahead even if the hard cap isn't reached we have been able to reach our soft cap.

Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.

Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Thanks for the article mate, it gave me so much information on what's currently happening with this project and I couldn't believe there are a lot of things coming for DataBroker DAO. I really think this bonus is such a good idea to reward old investors and to attract new investors to the platform. I'm also very stoked to hear about the new developments regarding the platform and these new exchanges that the team are teasing, by the sound of it I'm pretty sure it's a solid exchange.  That's great news! I'm glad that the project still continues even though the hard cap wouldn't be reach it would be a waste if the team wouldn't continue the project, they've already done a lot regarding the development of the platform anyway I'm just curious why did the team decided to extend the token sale? Honestly I didn't read that explanation on the article.

Body: Nice to know that you've extended the token sale, the fact that you didn't even reach a quarter of your hard cap is really heartbreaking, I hope by extending the token sale we will collect more funds and reach half of our hardcap or maybe completely reach the hardcap but if ever the hard cap wouldn't be reach, will the token sale still be extended? And if ever we wouldn't reach the hard cap, will the team still continue with the development of the project? Because if I'm not mistaken the soft cap has already been reached right? And this news will it affect the bounty hunters? Will the team allocate more tokens to the bounty campaign now that they've extended their token sale? Because I think they should, the bounty campaign's been long enough, I think the team should add more tokens to the bounty pool so that bounty hunters will get the rewards that they deserve for working for 5 months straight.

Author: rukewetony
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Sensor owners are able to monetize their data and turn a sunk cost into a potential money maker and at least the opportunity to recoup some of their investments in IoT sensors. The key role of Sensor Owners in DataBroker DAO is to sell the data from their sensors on the platform. They can also restrict who can buy the data I would suggest you try out the beta platform so you see how it works https://beta.databrokerdao.com/  While the Data Buyers are those stakeholders who will purchase data on the platform. The scope of this purchase could be to use the data in its raw form, for their own purposes, or to transform/enrich the raw data to be resold with added value via DataBroker DAO (see Data Processor below). The use of the data purchased by Data Buyers can be quite straightforward, for instance purchasing temperature and rainfall data provisioned by a neighboring office building to get accurate local readings, to the more complex, like purchasing data to train one‚Äôs AI.

Author: rukewetony
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Yes we already have a working platform.  If you want to know how selling or buying IoT sensor data would work on Databroker, check out the BETA version of the platform: https://beta.databrokerdao.com/  The data flows from the sensor to the gateway operator. Like a telco for example. The gateway operator runs the dAPI on their end (so every gateway operator runs their copy of the dAPI and their blockchain node). Secondly, the marketplace records who owns what at what time in the smart contracts. When you buy access, you also specify a target where it needs to go, e.g. your AWS S3 bucket. Now every time data comes into the gateway operator, it will pass it to the dAPI that will check who has bought access to it. it will then send the data onwards to the location specified in the purchase. The gateway operator takes a percentage of the sale to cover the server and network costs to do so. so as a buyer, you pay DTX tokens and add a target location, and the data will appear there. The data itself does not flow over the blockchain network, the scale would be impossible.

Author: rukewetony
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: There's currently a lot of activity going on, the CEO is now in Grand Cayman at the World Tokenomic Forum for the pitch competition vs 16 projects. There have been some fantastic projects and DataBroker DAO went head to head with them and came out a winner! We are now into the quarterfinals! The crowd sale is also Live until May 26th, 2018 4PM CET or until the hard cap is reached.  Unsold tokens will be kept by the platform. The platform will retain 25% of all tokens, minus all tokens needed for the referral scheme, plus all unsold tokens.  The purpose of these tokens is twofold. On the one hand, a reserve of tokens allows for follow-up sales to accelerate growth and allows the platform to do some limited market making. This is crucial since the liquidity of a utility token is paramount in the functioning of the platform. At the same time, some of the raised ETH will also be kept in reserve for these market-making purposes.  An additional 10 percent of the tokens are reserved for the team fund. The majority of the team fund will be distributed to team members joining the platform and will be vested in stages over 3 years. The unvested tokens will be returned to the fund in case the team member leaves the team. The rest will be distributed to current team members and advisors.

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: DataBroker DAO: Sensor Data Exchange Platform Announces Worldwide Roadshow Dates  Decentralized blockchain platform DataBroker DAO, offers both everyday users and large companies the option to buy and sell something called ‚Äòsencor data‚Äô. This Information is used for research and analysis to be freely traded on the market. DataBroker DAO have announced their tour dates for their world-wide globe trotting roadshow, which is set to commence on April 16th.  In the last 10 years, there has been a huge expansion of mobile technology and most people now own at least one device. These sensor devices are now the norm and will only grow in popularity as the technology advances. DataBroker DAO intends to give device users the ability to sell their data to buyers, in what might prove to be a huge market in the future.  Read the details in the article of Coinidol dot com, the world blockchain news outlet: https://coinidol.com/databroker-dao-announces-worldwide-roadshow-dates/

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Data Broker DAO‚Äôs Uses Blockchain Tech to Develop Sensor Data Marketplace, Token Sale Now Live  Decentralized marketplace for sensor data, DataBroker DAO, has commenced its main token sale, giving event participants across the world the chance to purchase the platform‚Äôs native DTX cryptocurrency.  The blockchain-backed platform makes it possible for all device owners to monetize their personal data and gives various business enterprises the chance to amass the most correct and ethically sourced data.  The main token sale is currently underway and is offering DTX tokens for a temporarily discounted rate. DataBroker DAO is using its decentralized marketplace to offer an affordable and ethic service for both buyers and sellers of sensor data.  Read the details in the article of Coinidol dot com, the world blockchain news outlet: https://coinidol.com/data-broker-dao-token-sale-now-live/

Author: Vinylriff
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: This can be one such mission, the Project offers a Decentralised Marketplace that specialises in IoT sensor data:  Below is a use case:  A phd in water management contacted me to inquire about DBDAO for selling data for sustainable water management systems. He has been studying sustainable water management systems for many years, which involves an array of sensors, the readings these sensors emit, incredible software he has been working on and higly performant hardware (the physical sensor). The value of the data from such systems is something I had not even considered but the data apparently has incredible value to improve how we use water in our cities and societies as a whole.  I am always amazed by the use cases that continue to come up from entrepreneurs and academics from completely diverse backgrounds drawn to DBDAO by the possibility of creating a sustainable and monetisable data driven future. The creativity of these folks in recognising new use cases simply blows my mind at least once a day.

Author: themathiasmiller
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: With the technologies and innovations that are present in today's society, data is definitely very valuable, that's why a lot of people seeks for data, some even go to the point where they will steal other people's data just to profit from it. That's why having a marketplace for IoT sensor data is a must, people who are owners of these sensors should have the access to sell their own data and with DataBroker Dao they can do it the easiest way possible. I am actually an investor, the first thing that drawn me to this project is there beta platform, the idea is great and the vision is really something that can be beneficial to the society but the fact that they already have a beta platform that you can test out was that something that got me to invest my money. You should really look deeper into this, study the whitepapper, research the team and also test out the platform, it will really help you decide whether this project is worth your money or not.

Author: aarondes
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: There are 3 commonly named projects that live in the same sphere: Streamr, IOTA and OceanProtocol.  Streamr is taking their traditional data transfer platform and will attempt to ‚Äúblockhainize‚Äù it. While we will not go into a deep technical analysis of these projects the conclusion can be drawn from reading the whitepaper that the goal is to replace the entire IoT stack, from top to bottom, with the Streamr solution. A monumental challenge if you keep in mind that if they are operational in 2 years, they will have to replace an industry with 30 billion deployed sensors.  IOTA‚Äôs plan is similar. But they go even further, aside from replacing the entire IoT ecosystem, they also replace any underlying blockchain base with a new and untested network, using a concept called a ‚Äútangle‚Äù. Double down on the challenges.  Both Streamr and IOTA describe a data marketplace. A marketplace for data on the the Streamr or IOTA platform/network. Of, at some point in time, one of them has replaced the IoT ecosystem, the winner would indeed be a real competitor for DataBroker DAO to break down data silos and facilitate the easy transfer of data, regardless of the underlying network.  OceanProtocol is a different story. Their focus is a new kind of BigchainDB-based network specifically for buying and selling AI datasets. While not a lot is known at this point, the roadmap specifies several years before their solution will be ready and the underlying technology is less decentralised/open compared to an Ethereum based solution.   DataBroker DAO takes a radically different approach: It is built to go into production this year. This ensures we both need to use proven technology, and a first movers advantage over these other players.

Author: kvanier
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: DataBroker DAO will connect any sensor owners with purchasers of the data directly, utilising existing infrastructure from telecommunication providers operating sensor connectivity networks based on GSM, LoRa, SigFox or via a proprietary gateway of the sensor owner. Our platform is specifically for those who operate sensors who want the ability to access the data that the 'big guys' hold now that is not typically available to just anyone.  There are a number of data sellers identified and the overview of the sectors already investing in sensors from Gartner highlights the key potential sellers of data for the years to come.  As far as who can buy data, aside from the data processors in the ecosystem, any company looking to commercialise a product that is data driven is provided with the opportunity to develop the product without having to invest in the hardware. The potential buyers are extremely broad.  Please check out our whitepaper, pp. 11-13, for more information on potential users of DataBroker DAO: https://databrokerdao.com/whitepaper/WHITEPAPER_DataBrokerDAO_en.pdf

Author: kvanier
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: DataBroker DAO is a peer to peer marketplace created to provide IoT sensor owners with a clear path to data monetization and data consumers with a decentralized market to buy IoT sensor data. With DataBroker DAO, we aspire to unleash long-tail creativity with the use of sensor data to facilitate the conversion of incredible ideas into value adding services. By providing a distributed foundational layer for the buying and selling of IoT sensor data, we expect that unimagined uses of data that exist in the hearts and minds of entrepreneurs, researchers and organisations around the world, will emerge to create incredible value adding services that enrich the quality of life in our cities and our societies as a whole. Body: Hello,  DataBroker is intended for non-personal data emitted from smart city, smart manufacturing, smart agriculture, etc whereas "smart home" data is by nautre directly personal. To sell such data on DBDAO, the anonymity of the sensor data would have to be ensured (for instance removing geo-coordinates and personal identifiers). This would reduce the marketability of the data however, is required to ensure that the data would not be misused. The inclusion of this data for resell on DBDAO would therefore be subject to screening.

Author: Twixxi691
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Many will benefit from this project, not just sensor owners:  Sensor owners Are able to monetize their data and turn a sunk cost into a potential money maker and at least the opportunity to recoup some of their investments in IoT sensors. The key role of Sensor Owners in DataBroker DAO is to sell the data from their sensors on the platform.  Network operators Gain scale and speed in the adoption of their network as connected telcos can present a win-back to their enterprise accounts, a clear USP. The key role of Network Operators in DataBroker DAO is to expose the gateway they operate to enable sensor owners to sell their data on the platform.  Sensor manufacturers Can stop the "race to the bottom‚Äù for production and pull resources and capital out of manufacturing and allocate these to profitable SaaS offerings.  Smart city initiatives Can limit the upfront cost of populating the town with sufficient sensors and turn the expense into an investment with a 2-3 year payback period and a continuous income stream after that.  Agricultural sector In the Agricultural sector in Belgium today, 10% of farmers are "techie". They deploy sensors include for wind, temperature, barometric pressure, humidity, PH level in the soil. The platform will provide the possibility to recoup some of this cost.  Academics Can get access to thousands of sensors and can buy data directly and more cheap on the marketplace, cutting out established data providers.   Data Buyers Data Buyers are those stakeholders who will purchase data on the platform. The scope of this purchase could be to use the data in its raw form, for their own purposes, or to transform/enrich the raw data to be resold with added value via DataBroker DAO (see Data Processor below). The use of the data purchased by Data Buyers can be quite straightforward, for instance purchasing temperature and rainfall data provisioned by a neighboring office building to get accurate local readings, to the more complex, like purchasing data to train one‚Äôs AI.  Data Processors Data Processors are those Data Buyers who purchase data with the explicit intention of enriching the data and either reselling it or handling it for their clients. The enrichment may take many forms and Data Processors can be categorized by the level of insight provided: ‚Ä¢ Simple data services are the most common. Data brokers collect data from multiple sources and offer it in collected and conditioned form ‚Äî data which would otherwise be fragmented, conflicted, and sometimes unreliable. ‚Ä¢ Smart data services provide conditioned and calculated data, with analytical rules and calculations applied to derive further insight from the collected data and aid the decision making process. ‚Ä¢ Adaptive data services apply analysis to a customer‚Äôs request-specific data, combined with data in a context store. This is a more advanced form of service. It is estimated that there are more than 5,000 data processing companies worldwide relying on a vast array of open datasets, published by government agencies and non-governmental sources.

Author: Twixxi691
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: There are 3 commonly named projects that live in the same sphere: Streamr, IOTA and OceanProtocol.  Streamr is taking their traditional data transfer platform and will attempt to ‚Äúblockhainize‚Äù it. While we will not go into a deep technical analysis of these projects the conclusion can be drawn from reading the whitepaper that the goal is to replace the entire IoT stack, from top to bottom, with the Streamr solution. A monumental challenge if you keep in mind that if they are operational in 2 years, they will have to replace an industry with 30 billion deployed sensors.  IOTA‚Äôs plan is similar. But they go even further, aside from replacing the entire IoT ecosystem, they also replace any underlying blockchain base with a new and untested network, using a concept called a ‚Äútangle‚Äù. Double down on the challenges.  Both Streamr and IOTA describe a data marketplace. A marketplace for data on the the Streamr or IOTA platform/network. Of, at some point in time, one of them has replaced the IoT ecosystem, the winner would indeed be a real competitor for DataBroker DAO to break down data silos and facilitate the easy transfer of data, regardless of the underlying network.  OceanProtocol is a different story. Their focus is a new kind of BigchainDB-based network specifically for buying and selling AI datasets. While not a lot is known at this point, the roadmap specifies several years before their solution will be ready and the underlying technology is less decentralised/open compared to an Ethereum based solution.   DataBroker DAO takes a radically different approach: It is built to go into production this year. This ensures we both need to use proven technology, and a first movers advantage over these other players.

Author: kvanier
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: There are 3 commonly named projects that live in the same sphere: Streamr, IOTA and OceanProtocol.  Streamr is taking their traditional data transfer platform and will attempt to ‚Äúblockhainize‚Äù it. While we will not go into a deep technical analysis of these projects the conclusion can be drawn from reading the whitepaper that the goal is to replace the entire IoT stack, from top to bottom, with the Streamr solution. A monumental challenge if you keep in mind that if they are operational in 2 years, they will have to replace an industry with 30 billion deployed sensors.  IOTA‚Äôs plan is similar. But they go even further, aside from replacing the entire IoT ecosystem, they also replace any underlying blockchain base with a new and untested network, using a concept called a ‚Äútangle‚Äù. Double down on the challenges.  Both Streamr and IOTA describe a data marketplace. A marketplace for data on the the Streamr or IOTA platform/network. Of, at some point in time, one of them has replaced the IoT ecosystem, the winner would indeed be a real competitor for DataBroker DAO to break down data silos and facilitate the easy transfer of data, regardless of the underlying network.  OceanProtocol is a different story. Their focus is a new kind of BigchainDB-based network specifically for buying and selling AI datasets. While not a lot is known at this point, the roadmap specifies several years before their solution will be ready and the underlying technology is less decentralised/open compared to an Ethereum based solution.   DataBroker DAO takes a radically different approach:  - It is built to go into production this year. This ensures we both need to use proven technology, and a first movers advantage over these other players.  - It is built to interface with the large players in the ecosystem (manufacturers and gateway operators) in a non invasive way. We are not replacing anything or anyone, ensuring a low friction environment. The only way to get market scale fast enough.  - It focuses on being a complementary component in the current and future ecosystem, meaning that in the future DataBroker DAO can co-exist, integrate and complement IOTA, Streamr and OceanProtocol.  We wish each and every one of these projects all the success in the world, and we will happily integrate them into the ecosystem upon reaching critical mass.

Author: kvanier
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: We wish each and every one of our competitors and otherwise similar endeavors all the success in the world, and we will happily integrate them into the DataBroker DAO ecosystem!

Author: rukewetony
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: We are not blind to the usability issue in using separate tokens on a public blockchain for any type of user. We are working on several solutions to ease adoption. A major one is that we will facilitate corporations to purchase tokens from DataBroker DAO directly. These tokens will come out of the reserved platform fund and will be sold for fiat currency with full invoicing, just like any other digital good. We will not buy back tokens or issue more. By implementing a token for purchasing sensor data, we are enabling microtransactions for corporate users as well as lower-level users to have access to purchasing sensor data. We are dedicated to creating an ecosystem that enables this widespread adoption.

Author: aarondes
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: SettleMint is the parent company, we developed DBDAO and are spinning it out into a separate company now in combination with the token sale for funds.  Right now we are all focussing on DBDAO. Getting the platform ready and onboarding new team members is a time intensive job. As new people are hired, we will appoint them depending on their skills to either DataBrokerDAO or SettleMint projects. There is some overlap now, but the goal is to move to fully independent teams apart from the board of directors.  SettleMint is registered both out of Belgium and the UAE. DatabrokerDao is associated with the UAE company.

Author: aarondes
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: A lot of the added value in sensors only comes after analysing, aggregating and enhancing the data streams from sensors. The datasets in the platform function like a tertiary market where sensor buyers can do all kinds of smart things with the data, and resell them in easily consumed datasets.  Sensors are being listed in the application for discovery of data. The current implementation is by design rudimentary and not built for billions of sensors. We were focussing on proving the platform and the implementation of discoverability, curation and reputation on a scale of billions of sensors is a monumental feat (e.g. the iOS app store). In the roadmap we have set aside time to build on this base and develop a solution at scale.  Please see page 27-28 in our whitepaper for a layout of how the app will display and aggregate sensor data for the user: https://databrokerdao.com/whitepaper/WHITEPAPER_DataBrokerDAO_en.pdf

Author: rukewetony
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: The DATA token is a utility token in the Databroker DAO platform. The DATA token is a ERC20 compliant token with 18 decimals. The token will serve as the credit to buy and sell sensor data within the platform  Choosing to use a token over fiat or ETH allows us to use the divisibility that is needed to operate micro transactions in a market with over half a trillion individual devices that produce data in the range of every second. Having this abstraction layer on top of ETH also prevents the token to be subject to the large fluctuations of the ETH price. The volatility of the DATA token will be more limited and can be controlled in a limited fashion, with some market making using reserved funds and tokens.

Author: rukewetony
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Yes you can. The types of entities that may benefit from the data include sensor owners, network operators, sensor manufacturers, smarty city initiatives, agricultural sector, academics, data buyers/ processors and even the automotive sector. Just in data processors, it is estimated that there are more than 5,000 companies worldwide relying on a vast array of open datasets, published by government agencies and non-governmental sources.

Author: kvanier
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: An important distinction about DataBroker DAO‚Äôs potential market size is that we are not looking for the size of the sensor market itself, but the market for the data they emit. Sensor owners purchase sensors for primary usage because they believe that what they can do with the data is more valuable than the cost of acquiring, deploying and maintaining the sensors. The market for sensors does however provide a clear indication of the amount of data that is available for sale today and in the years to come. Estimating the market size for the data is then a function of estimating the demand for the available data.  Agricultural sector: in Belgium today, 10% of farmers are ‚Äútechie‚Äù. They have a drone flying around and 5-20 sensors deployed and some other automation in place. The sensors include for instance wind, temperature, barometric pressure, humidity, PH level in the soil. They use these to manage their farm and spend between 10-50k euro per year, and DataBroker DAO will provide the possibility to recoup some of this cost.  Please check out our whitepaper to learn more: https://databrokerdao.com/whitepaper/WHITEPAPER_DataBrokerDAO_en.pdf

Author: aarondes
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: As a peer-to-peer marketplace for buying and selling streaming sensor data, we focus primarily on this already significant addition to the IoT sensor and smart "everything" ecosystem. As we grow into the "go-to" marketplace for sensor data in the coming years, we do however foresee extending the functionalities of DataBroker to support the peer to peer sales of IoT hardware and sensors. Based on the feedback from our Alliance members and after some initial discussions with some of our fellow members of AIOTI (https://aioti.eu/), we are continuing to further work on the roadmap for DataBroker.  At a high level, we see the platform evolving along the lines of buy-sell data (phase 1), buy-sell services (phase 2), buy-sell hardware (phase 3). We aim to have an updated and more comprehensive roadmap available in the next week or so highlighting the phases of development and growth for DataBroker in the years to come.

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Making Sense of Sensor Data: Blockchain Startup DataBroker DAO Updates IoT Marketplace Platform to V2 and Begins Token Pre-Sale  A relatively under-discussed topic at present is the dramatic increase of investment and value within the Internet of Things (IoT) sensor data market; while it is expected to be worth 1.2 Trillion USD in 2019, it is still being hindered by companies and industries that reserve their sensor data within data silos.The majority of sensor data is locked away within their respective sensor owners, and 10% of that data is ‚Äòsought for others‚Äô - that‚Äôs roughly 120 Billion USD worth of data that will be unavailable.  A Blockchain startup in Dubai, DataBroker DAO, have sought to make sense of this mess and open up an IoT sensor data marketplace that is built on blockchain technology.The DataBroker DAO team have developed a platform on which users, companies and any owner of any IoT sensor device can buy and sell their data to any individual or organisation in the world. IoT sensor data can enlighten city governments with the lifestyle habits of their citizens, and marketing companies can better design their campaigns, academics and researchers can benefit from the enormous wealth of data and so on.  Read the details in the article of Coinidol dot com, the world blockchain news outlet: https://coinidol.com/databroker-dao-updates-iot-marketplace-platform/

Author: romfish
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: You are right - the load on the platform network will be significant. The data comes from (billion) sensors of the owners. Owners sign a contract with a network operator (telecommunications company or manufacturer) to transfer the data generated by sensors through (Internet) gateway gateways for further use or processing. But there is an interesting solution for developers - to attract network operators, who take the role of a gateway controller through which data streams are transmitted.

Author: alexvilis
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Wireless solution specialist Option joins the DataBroker DOA alliance https://medium.com/databrokerdao/wireless-solution-specialist-option-joins-the-databroker-doa-alliance-8ab9e3ce48ad  We are immensely looking forward to exploring this integration further over the next months and to learning from such an established and global player in the mobile communication sector.  Option, headquartered in Leuven, Belgium is a publicly traded tech company that specializes in wireless solutions enabling machine to machine communication. With over 30 years of experience and many industry firsts, the company offers efficient, reliable and secure solutions across a variety of industries and applications. In 2005, Option was named ‚ÄòCompany of the Year‚Äô by Ernst & Young. The company has offices in Europe, the United States and Australia, and boasts an impressive customer portfolio history featuring the likes of Sharp Corporation, Fujitsu Siemens, T-Mobile, Cingular Wireless (now AT&T), Vodafone, Orange, Airtel, Telstra, Acer and Samsung Electronics.  Recently the company shifted focus from mobile and wireless chipsets to devices to support communication between IoT sensors and the internet. CloudGate, their complete machine to machine communication platform, allows anyone to deploy IoT sensor arrays in any environment, anywhere in the world. With connection options through WiFi, Ethernet, USB, RS232, RS485, Digital I/O and Analog I/O, virtually any device can be connected. The possibilities are endless. Think of climate control, street lighting, fleet monitoring, shared bike rentals, smart metering, traffic control, independent living and much, much more.  Looking at the DataBroker DAO architecture, such a CloudGate box is, in essence, a gateway operator providing the connection between the sensor and the sensor owner. By tying in the DataBroker DAO marketplace and distributed API to these boxes, anyone deploying these CloudGate devices gains the opportunity to quickly sell the data they collect globally, without the need for intermediaries.  Option‚Äôs CloudGate Ecosystem With CloudGate M2M Solutions Option delivers a complete, value-centric ecosystem of operators, hardware partners, application partners, AEP partners and systems integrators to the M2M marketplace. And from a certification standpoint, Option has you covered worldwide.

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Databroker DAO Launch Pre-Sale and Announce IOT Sensor Data Marketplace, Scheduled March 19th 2018  DataBroker DAO, the first blockchain marketplace to sell and buy Internet of Things (IoT) sensor data. DataBroker has announced the launch of their Presale token event set to start March 19th, 2018 - 4pm CET.  A remedy to the lost wealth of opportunities caused by IoT sensor data being locked away in the data stores of organizations around the world. The growth of IoT has presented the industry with an unscalable amount of opportunities, for industries, governments, research bodies and many other sectors spending hundreds of billions yearly on purchasing and maintaining IoT sensors.  Read the details in the article of Coinidol dot com, the world blockchain news outlet: https://coinidol.com/databroker-dao-launch-pre-sale/

Body: Definitely not the best course of events but these kind of things always happen in the cryptocurrency world, this isn't new and this kind of thing doesn't hurt a project at all, it can ofcourse decrease the price for a short period of time but after the dip more and more people will accumulate and buy cheap so the price will eventually rise again and become way higher than it was before, that's basically the cycle of every project that had a bounty or had an ico with bonuses. As long as the team is still developing this project, following the roadmap and is still very active in marketing then we all have nothing to worry about, price is bound to increase.

This will boost Databroker development for sure!  Technilog offers innovative solutions based on proprietary technologies and on a network of specialized partnerships to address a wide range of industrial needs.

Author: Vladdirescu87
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Databroker DAO - Universal Decentralised Marketplace for IoT Sensor Data, Token Sale Starts on March  What is Databroker DAO?  Databroker DAO is a distributed marketplace that connects sensor owners with data buyers. Essentially it could be called an ‚ÄúAmazon‚Äù for IoT sensor data.  DataBroker DAO is the first marketplace to sell & purchase sensor data. It uses Blockchain technology and enables sensor owners to turn generated data into revenue streams.  Read more: https://medium.com/@coinidol.com2017/databoker-dao-universal-decentralised-marketplace-for-iot-sensor-data-token-sale-starts-on-march-fd6db3592d26

Author: rukewetony
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: We are talking to some truck manufacturers, no car specific alliance partners yet. We put a high premium on execution. We have spent most of last year iterating the product and validating the business model with end users ranging from sensor manufacturers to smart cities to telecommunications companies that operate connectivity networks and provide the gateway services that form the infrastructure needs of today's connected world (over 10 billion sensors). These efforts have been focused on European, North American, Middle East and Asian markets primarily. The resoundingly positive feedback we receive from these end user stakeholder groups for databroker has (and continues to be) unanimous. This has been gruelling but has brought us far beyond average in terms of ensuring the need in the market is fulfilled. Thank you for your support and confidence.

Author: r0derik
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: The platform is using a percentage based fee. The percentage is set to 10% right now but can vary according to market conditions.  Quote from: spottcoin on October 12, 2017, 12:04:16 PM In the white paper you forecast the potential demand for information describing groups of possible consumers. How will you act, if not all of these groups are interested in your service and the demand will be much lower suggestions that will be lead to the decline of interest in DataBroker DAO from the sellers data?  We have market tested the platform since January on conferences with buyers and sellers. We are very sure that there is demand. And if we are totally wrong, we need to adjust our plan/offering to match.  Quote from: 16009 on October 12, 2017, 12:42:48 PM What will you do with the remaining tokens, if not the entrie amount will be realized after ICO?  We only mine the tokens that are actually sold. So that would be the supply in circulation. Though we reserve the right to organise a follow-up sale in the future (nothing planned btw) and sell these leftover tokens at that time.  Quote from: MadduckUK on October 12, 2017, 01:03:13 PM As far as I understand, growing your token will be long-term. But the project is serious. If not secret how much you've collected at the moment?  In our early sale we have a little over 900ETH right now. You can follow up live on https://databrokerdao.com  Quote from: AurihanGB on October 12, 2017, 01:26:45 PM Hello! The owners of the sensors and sensors can offer service only to the sale, or to additional ways to monetize their activities?  The platform allows for what we call data processors. Companies buying data, doing smart things with it (bigdata, ai, etc) and then selling this data onwards.  Quote from: hunterofmoney on October 12, 2017, 01:34:26 PM The data providers are stored on your servers on not? If so, will i have the sellers info to pay  for the storage of sensor data and sensors?  No the data is not stored on our servers. The buyer can choose where to send the data he or she bought.  Quote from: polonium84 on October 13, 2017, 05:17:58 AM The information from the sensors, and sensor suppilers will be "broadcast" to consumers in real-time or updated at regular intervals of time?  In realtime. Tough e,g the LoRa sensors have a low rate, so it might only send a reading once per hour.  Quote from: coin63 on October 13, 2017, 05:53:03 AM How do you plan to limit the volatility of their tokens?  Not actively at least. The DATA token will vary, especially at the beginning. We assume that in the long term the value of these tokens will stabilise based on real word performance of the company. Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: That is the reason for the token. We need one for the state channels and microtransactions. Pure utility.   Do token holders receive any reward for staking?  Not as of yet.   Your white paper mentioned something about your token being used on your platform instead of Ethereum because of volatility of the Ethereum price. Does this mean that your token won't be traded on exchanges to avoid price fluctuations?  Since the project is a "real" business, we hope the volatility will be less than ETH in the long run. if this proves to be a false assumption, we are looking into solutions like a Variable and a stable coin.   In short, is the ICO only a form of crowd funding or is there some other benefit to investing that I missed?  Apart from being part of one of the very few practical, going into production, projects?

Author: tr1ple6
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: As I stated before, I like your project. I still do not see the benefit to the ICO investor (me) though. If I invest then the 'stability' of the coin means that there is little to no prospect of profit since it will be used solely on your platform. Add to that no staking and this means that buying the token from an investment point of view just doesn't add up.  I get that this is a real business but you are asking people to invest real money in an ICO without clearly explaining potential benefits. This project should be receiving a lot more buzz and perhaps the lack of the value proposition from an investment point of view is the reason it isn't? Add your coin to exchanges so the market can decide its true value and it will serve as an incentive to your development team to grow your project thereby increasing their investment. Add a staking element so that ICO investors buy and hold instead of try to dump their tokens at the first available opportunity.  Check projects like WaltonChain to see how to build a community of passionate stakeholders.  I wish you all the best!

Author: r0derik
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: From the whitepaper  WHY USE BLOCKCHAIN? From a marketplace perspective, using the public Ethereum chain enables the use of a fully built financial ecosystem, with a minimum of fees. Traditional fiat payment processors charge between 1 and 3% for money in and money out, while a purchase using the utility token costs around 0.003 USD in fees for purchases of any size.  Using a utility token over fiat currency also brings the advantage of 18 decimals. Combine the possibility to use extremely small fractions of the token with very low fees, and real microtransactions become possible.  From a decentralized network perspective, it is also a perfect fit. Very large numbers of participants, in a trustless environment, transacting with each other is the definition of a perfect use-case.  From an ecosystem perspective, we notice a lot of activity in the IoT sphere, solving a lot of hard problems for the future. And we are avid fans of these trailblazers knowing that Databroker DAO is a great add-on for many of these projects ‚Äì the missing link in the ecosystem.

Author: r0derik
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: From the whitepaper  WHY USE BLOCKCHAIN? From a marketplace perspective, using the public Ethereum chain enables the use of a fully built financial ecosystem, with a minimum of fees. Traditional fiat payment processors charge between 1 and 3% for money in and money out, while a purchase using the utility token costs around 0.003 USD in fees for purchases of any size.  Using a utility token over fiat currency also brings the advantage of 18 decimals. Combine the possibility to use extremely small fractions of the token with very low fees, and real microtransactions become possible.  From a decentralized network perspective, it is also a perfect fit. Very large numbers of participants, in a trustless environment, transacting with each other is the definition of a perfect use-case.  From an ecosystem perspective, we notice a lot of activity in the IoT sphere, solving a lot of hard problems for the future. And we are avid fans of these trailblazers knowing that Databroker DAO is a great add-on for many of these projects ‚Äì the missing link in the ecosystem.

Author: r0derik
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Quite a few of our new community members have been asking whether DataBroker DAO is trying to compete with IOTA? to address this, our CEO has written the following blog post: https://medium.com/databrokerdao/is-databroker-dao-taking-on-iota-342dc1481812

Author: Aridon
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Thanks for pointing that out, I can see how Proximus might find it interesting - https://eurocomms.com/industry-news/11968-proximus-starts-selling-customer-data-reports-for-700-a-time  Yet, I am puzzled how it translates to the platform. Let's take this Proximus case for example. Your white paper states that sensor owners will be directly remunerated when their data is bought. Does this mean that actual phone owners will profit directly from Databroker DAO? The whitepaper mentions that the average sensor has a value of ~12 USD per year. You based your ICO token value on that number. With 14 sensors in the average smartphone, that would mean that a single phone would be good for about $168 worth of sensor data per year. Granted, not all sensors would be useful or equally interesting to be traded, but still, it's a large amount.  And besides phone owners, will car owners, smart TV viewers, home automation owners profit directly? And will all of them need a wallet and a Managed Identity Contract, as your whitepaper mentions? I'm genuinely curious. If the general public is going to benefit directly from Databroker DAO, that would make the scope and scale of it all massively different than when the benefits reach no further than data harvesters like Proximus, Volkswagen, Samsung and Google. Could you elaborate on this please?

Author: r0derik
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: The distinction to make is that we are not targetting phones, nor home automation. Or at least not anything that is "personal" data. It is set up to directly remunerate the actual sensor owners, so the scale is indeed as you describe, immense. We deal with that scope by going through the network operators, since they already handle their clients and why they need to be compensated for their involvement.

Author: cryptominded
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: We're on-boarding a few early platform users, for example: YukTix from India (http://www.yuktix.com/), who have air quality sensor all around cities. They'll be selling this data on the DataBroker marketplace and are currently integrating on our API.  Many more conversations are currently happening with smart city initiatives, manufacturers and data aggregators from around the world. We've recently received a letter of support from the Brussels city government to start working out how DataBrokerDAO could be used in the smart city project in Brussels. Really exciting!  Come and join us on our slack and have a chat with us, we'd be happy to answer any questions you may have.

Author: vivland
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: In my opinion the process of sampling and determination of air quality has long been automatic cycle, as your tokens can affect this process? What are they so unique? I don't understand...   Even if you invented a new Protocol, it does not mean that your quality will be higher than the existing practice. And another question: isn't it too narrow a range of tasks of your token? thank you.

Author: cryptominded
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: The sampling and determination of air quality is not something databroker is involved in. Yuktix will be able to sell their air quality data on the DataBrokerDAO platform which is paid for with DATA tokens. This is only a single application of the many potential ones out there.  Quote from: spiderlee on September 09, 2017, 03:45:41 AM Referral program only no social media bounty?  You can post the referral link on social media to earn from people that sign-up through your link and contribute. There's no bounty program, as the referral program is essentially that.  Quote from: AmoreJaz on September 09, 2017, 03:58:26 AM the use of big data from the IOT is a hard job to tackle! and even the storage data centers need to be upgraded to receive this data . there are many aspects of big data not covered in this project and would certainly benefit from a blockchain structure.  As storage of data is becoming cheaper and cheaper, we don't see this as a major issue. However, we'll take the necessary actions needed to ensure storage & high availability of the data.  Quote from: CaVO32 on September 09, 2017, 04:19:06 AM what about the privacy acts in the various countries when maintaining IOT data? how will your company comply with all the different countries?  At the moment, we are still exploring this. We may not yet accept privacy sensitive data on the platform.

Author: darklow
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Interesting project, will definitely be following. One question though: Would you mind sharing with me how DataBroker & IOTA compete (and what the differences are) or are they complimentary?

Author: cryptominded
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Hi Darklow, great question!  IOTA & DataBroker DAO are complementary projects.  IOTA‚Äôs tangles are an awesome concept. But they do not support smart contracts (yet) and they appear to be too simple to build a marketplace. https://www.reddit.com/r/Iota/comments/6fdtq4/can_iota_do_decentralised_smartcontracts/ We are planning to integrate with IOTA as a transport layer, both in and out.

Author: cryptominded
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Have you wondered why a marketplace for IoT sensor data is needed and how it adds value to the IoT industry? We wrote an article which goes into these topics.  https://medium.com/databrokerdao/how-the-databroker-marketplace-for-iot-sensor-data-adds-value-to-the-iot-industry-1a282e286135

Author: cryptominded
Title: [ANN][Open Nowüî•]DataBroker DAO ‚≠ê Decentralised marketplace for IoT sensor data.
Body: Hi Kickcity, sorry that must be a disrepancy in our information, will fix that.  The rate is: 1 ETH = 1200 DATA 11.250.000 / 1200 = 9375 ETH  This is our funding goal.
